head.supplied: 20/1/81. ¶ ¶ You are aware, dear Mr Carson, that my means of obtaining seeds now are so limited, that with all my wish to respond to your call, I can do but little for you. I have however managed to ...

div.p: ML MSS 6860, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.
MS is accompanied by a list of 'Officers of H.M.S. Wolverene' (sic). Carson was botanist on Wolverine during its Pacific voyage in 1879. 20/1/81.

You are aware, dear Mr Carson, that my means of obtaining seeds now are so limited, that with all my wish to respond to your call, I can do but little for you. I have however managed to get about 30 sorts together, which I send simultaneously with this letter. So you will see at all events my good will. The delay arose from my multifarious extraengagements on several juries for the international exhibition.
International Exhibition, Melbourne, 1880-1.
When in your rambles about Sydney you might readily gather many seeds in the rich vegetation there for your friend.
Kindly remember, that the marine weeds (Seagrasses) of port Jackson are as yet very imperfectly known.
